intro: Chaetolimon setiferum, commonly known as the hairy sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb with succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in dry environments. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in spring. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to stabilize sandy soils. Chaetolimon setiferum is often found in coastal dunes and rocky habitats where it plays a role in preventing soil erosion.
